content.summary: A multi-tenant SaaS back-office platform providing real-time inventory tracking, automated stock replenishment, and vendor management for restaurant operations.
content.description: The platform centralizes back-of-house operations for restaurant owners and managers. It focuses on reducing COGS through precise inventory management, waste tracking, and automated purchasing workflows, catering to both single-location and multi-unit enterprises.

user_stories.title: Multi-tenant Account Setup
user_stories.story: As a restaurant owner, I want to create a secure tenant account so that my inventory and financial data are isolated from other businesses.
user_stories.description: Implement a multi-tenant architecture using schema-based isolation. Include secure sign-up with organization profile creation.
acceptance_criteria: System creates a unique organization ID for every new registration
Users from Tenant A cannot access or query data belonging to Tenant B
Registration requires email verification and 2FA setup
Organization profile includes currency, timezone, and tax settings
user_stories.user_value: Ensures data privacy and security in a shared SaaS environment.

user_stories.title: Inventory Item Cataloging
user_stories.story: As a kitchen manager, I want to define inventory items with unit costs and par levels so that I can track stock accurately.
user_stories.description: Create a CRUD interface for inventory items including SKU, category, unit of measure, and minimum stock thresholds.
acceptance_criteria: User can add, edit, or archive inventory items with unique SKUs
System supports multiple units of measure (e.g., kg, liters, cases)
Each item must have a defined 'Par Level' (minimum stock)
System calculates total value of stock based on last purchase price
user_stories.user_value: Provides a single source of truth for all raw materials and supplies.

user_stories.title: Automated Low-Stock Alerts
user_stories.story: As a back-office admin, I want to receive notifications when stock falls below par levels so that I can prevent ingredient shortages.
user_stories.description: Implement a background worker that compares current stock levels against par levels and triggers system notifications.
acceptance_criteria: System checks stock levels every 15 minutes against par levels
Notifications appear in the dashboard sidebar in real-time
Email alerts are sent to designated admins for 'Critical' shortages
Alerts include the item name, current quantity, and vendor info
user_stories.user_value: Reduces manual monitoring and prevents stockouts that disrupt service.

acceptance_criteria.criteria: The system must maintain 99.9% uptime for the inventory dashboard.
acceptance_criteria.description: High availability requirement for business-critical back-office operations.
acceptance_criteria.title: System Availability

acceptance_criteria.criteria: All API responses for inventory queries must return in under 200ms.
acceptance_criteria.description: Performance benchmark for smooth user experience during high-volume data entry.
acceptance_criteria.title: Response Latency

acceptance_criteria.criteria: Data must be encrypted at rest using AES-256 standards.
acceptance_criteria.description: Security requirement to protect sensitive financial and vendor data.
acceptance_criteria.title: Data Encryption

assumptions: Users have stable internet access for the web dashboard
Third-party POS systems provide accessible webhooks or APIs
Initial inventory data migration will be handled via CSV uploads
out_of_scope: Employee payroll processing and tax filing

stakeholders.interest: Profitability, COGS reduction, and multi-unit oversight
Ease of stock counting and preventing shortages
Accurate purchase orders and timely payments

invest_analysis.comments: Depends on US-1 for tenant context.
